titlestmt.titleproper: Morse Peckham manuscript for the Variorum edition of Darwin's Origin of Species 1958
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Morse Peckham manuscript for the Variorum edition of Darwin's Origin of Species
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Morse Peckham (1914-1993) was a literary theorist and scholar of Romanticism. He graduated from the University of Rochester with an M.A. and received his Ph.D. from Princeton University. Peckham taught at the University of Pennsylvania from 1949 to 1967 and at the University of South Carolina from 1967 to 1980. He is the author of numerous books including Manâ€™s Rage for Chaos, Explanation and Power, and The Romantic Virtuoso, 1815-1825.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a manuscript for Peckham's variorum edition of Darwin's Origin of Species, which includes paste-ups for the individual chapters with some penciled annotations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
